OK mate. Let me be more thorough then. You know that Clerics use Wisdom to cast, I presume, right? A Zen Archer is a Cleric that invests heavily on Wisdom to improve his casting and then takes a feat called Zen Archery, which allows his Ranged Attacks to be modified by Wisdom, instead of Dexterity. That will make him a very efficient caster and simultaneously a really good Ranged Combatant. But they are tricky to play because they are weak in melee, so you need to be good at avoiding it, and since you don't seem to have a lot of experience, I think you'll do better if you play something more "melee-like", like a dwarven Battle Cleric. posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Rienion wrote:
Hmm... I just realized the build might not work. I think Arelith still has the you have to go with the same class for 3 levels before you can change rule o.o
I know, and it does. Cleric 15, then Rogue 3 then CoT 7 all consecutive, then you can take whatever you want in whatever order as long as the first three levels of each class are taken consecutively.

As for advice to build, I will also refer you to the Game Guides section. Please read my "Complete Guide to the Basics of Building". You see, building characters is like a college degree, it'll literally take years to develop. It's a whole science in itself. Once you read all those guides I referred you to, you'll have a much better understanding of how broad the spectrum is. I would love to help you, but there's nothing I can do short-term except tell you to read the guides and take your time to sink it all in, then start experimenting with your builds. Post them right here for critiquing by the "elders" such as myself and Valerfor, but also HipMaestro, Mick Dagger, Empyre65, etc...

But don't go straight to experimenting before you read the guides. If you don't, you probably won't understand the advice that will be given to you. I would say that there are a few important things that you need to have a grasp of from the Complete Guide in order to be ready to understand our critique to your builds:

- BAB Progression (how it works and how it influences a build, the "rule of 4")
- Skill Dumps (what are skill dumps, which classes are normally taken for skill dumps, at which levels they are taken and why)
- Desirable Epic Feats and Requirements (Devastating Critical for a STR toon (if the server hasn't banned it, which many servers have), Epic Dodge for a DEX toon, Epic Spells for casters, Lasting Inspiration for Bards, Terrifying Rage for Barbarians, Epic Weapon Specialization for Fighters (or CoT builds with at least 4 Fighter levels), Automatic Still Spell for armor-wearing spellswords, etc..)
- Class Combos and Synergies (Cleric / Monk, Paladin / CoT, Fighter or any Melee class and RDD, Bard and Blackguard, Sorcerer / Paladin,  Druid / Monk and SO MANY OTHERS!)
- Optimizing Spreads and Pre-epic spreads (What is a spread and what is a pre-epic spread? What does it mean to optimize a build and a spread?)
- Optimizing the Leveling order (Which class to take first? Which feats to take first? Which Attribute Point to put where in which order?)

As you can see, building optimized toons is far from simple, and that's why I love it so much! We plan all the builds ahead of time. Every feat, every attribute point, every skill point and if we know the server very well, we even plan the gear they'll wear!

One thing, though, the Links in the guide are not working, and I have tried to edit them, but can't seem to do it. When I click on Edit post, the guide must be so big that only a part of it is displayed, and the part is the one which doesn't contain the links....

Have fun! I would like to see you become an Epic Character Builder! Do you have what it takes? Welcome to the big boys club LOL!!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Well, I do agree with you to a certain extent, but it can be really frustrating to die over and over again with an "enjoyable weak toon". Who's to say that an enjoyable character can't be powerful? If you take ANY concept, you can optimize it and make it the most powerful it can be, as long as you don't restrict your own options too much. I remember a Paladin player I once played with that said the following sentence to me: "Sir xxxxxx fights with honor" so he didn't take KD. Man, that to me is waaaayyy over the top. You KILL THINGS, GUT EVIL CREATURES, TAKE HEADS TO PROVE THEY ARE DEAD and you won't knock them over? You know what I mean? Anything is optimizeable and even not-uber toons can be fun to play and have nifty strategies and tricks, just pick your concept and you can optimize it within the scope of the concept.

But anyway, you've gone from wanting a Cleric to wanting a Death Knight to now wanting a Ranger. I know what it's like to have many characters you want to play! I haven't even played half my own builds! So, pick one and we'll happily build it for you. I'll let Val do the Bard BG Fighter one as he's really good with melee toons. If you want a bow Ranger, maybe Mick Dagger can help you. He wrote the guide on Arcane Archers here in the ECB (if you're interested it's in the Game Guides section). With Clerics, I kind of am the house expert, as self-buffers are my favorite kind of toon to play.

Take it EZ!
